chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Ring

Goal:
forall i j : nat, i <> j -> Mone_seq i j = zero

Premises:
Mone_seq = fix Mone_seq (i j : nat) {struct i} : T := match i with | 0%nat => match j with | 0%nat => one | S _ => zero end | S i0 => match j with | 0%nat => zero | S j0 => Mone_seq i0 j0 end end : nat -> nat -> T Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Mone_seq_diag : forall i j : nat, i = j -> Mone_seq i j = one
Mplus = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) (A B : matrix m n) => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => plus (coeff_mat zero A i j) (coeff_mat zero B i j)) : forall (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat), matrix m n -> matrix m n -> matrix m n Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope _ _]
Mopp = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) (A : matrix m n) => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => opp (coeff_mat zero A i j)) : forall (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat), matrix m n -> matrix m n Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope _]
coeff_mat = fun (T : Type) (m n : nat) (x0 : T) (A : matrix m n) (i j : nat) => coeff_Tn x0 (coeff_Tn (mk_Tn n (fun _ : nat => x0)) A i) j : forall (T : Type) (m n : nat), T -> matrix m n -> nat -> nat -> T Arguments T, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope nat_scope _ _ nat_scope nat_scope]
pow_n = fun K : Ring => fix pow_n (x : K) (N : nat) {struct N} : K := match N with | 0%nat => one | S i => mult x (pow_n x i) end : forall K : Ring, K -> nat -> K Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ nat_scope]
Nat.mul_eq_0_l : forall n m : nat, (n * m)%nat = 0%nat -> m <> 0%nat -> n = 0%nat
Nat.pow_eq_0 : forall a b : nat, b <> 0%nat -> (a ^ b)%nat = 0%nat -> a = 0%nat
Nat.eq_mul_0_l : forall n m : nat, (n * m)%nat = 0%nat -> m <> 0%nat -> n = 0%nat
Nat.pow_nonzero : forall a b : nat, a <> 0%nat -> (a ^ b)%nat <> 0%nat
Nat.div_mul_cancel_r : forall a b c : nat, b <> 0%nat -> c <> 0%nat -> (a * c / (b * c))%nat = (a / b)%nat
Nat.div_small_iff : forall a b : nat, b <> 0%nat -> (a / b)%nat = 0%nat < -> (a < b)%nat
Zdiv.div_Zdiv : forall n m : nat, m <> 0%nat -> Z.of_nat (n / m) = (Z.of_nat n / Z.of_nat m)%Z
Nat.mod_eq : forall a b : nat, b <> 0%nat -> a mod b = (a - b * (a / b))%nat
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0%nat -> x = (y * (x / y) + x mod y)%nat
Nat.mod_upper_bound : forall a b : nat, b <> 0%nat -> (a mod b < b)%nat
Mone = fun n : nat => mk_matrix n n Mone_seq : forall n : nat, matrix n n Argument n is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Nat.neq_0_lt_0 : forall n : nat, n <> 0%nat < -> (0 < n)%nat
le_n_0_eq : forall n : nat, (n <= 0)%nat -> 0%nat = n
inj_eq : forall x y : nat, x = y -> Z.of_nat x = Z.of_nat y
Nat.add_sub_eq_l : forall n m p : nat, (m + p)%nat = n -> (n - m)%nat = p
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
mk_matrix : forall m n : nat, (nat -> nat -> ?T) -> matrix m n where ?T : [T : Ring |- Type]
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
sum_n_m_const_zero : forall n m : nat, sum_n_m (fun _ : nat => zero) n m = zero where ?G : [T : Ring |- AbelianGroup]
Nat.add_comm : forall n m : nat, (n + m)%nat = (m + n)%nat
abs_eq_zero : forall x : ?K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero where ?K : [T : Ring |- AbsRing]
not_le : forall n m : nat, ~ (n <= m)%nat -> (n > m)%nat
norm_eq_zero : forall x : ?V, norm x = 0 -> x = zero where ?K : [T : Ring |- AbsRing] ?V : [T : Ring |- NormedModule ?K]
lt_S_n : forall n m : nat, (S n < S m)%nat -> (n < m)%nat
le_S_n : forall n m : nat, (S n <= S m)%nat -> (n <= m)%nat

```coq
intros i j H.
induction i.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. destruct j.
  + rewrite Mone_seq_diag. discriminate.
  + rewrite IHi. auto.
Qed.
```
